kidney_beans_details.description: Kidney beans are a type of common bean known for their distinctive kidney shape and rich flavor. They are popular in cuisines around the world and are prized for their nutritional value.
kidney_beans_details.nutritional value: Kidney beans are an excellent source of plant-based protein, dietary fiber, vitamins, and minerals. They support heart health, aid digestion, and help regulate blood sugar levels.
kidney_beans_details.uses: Soups, Stews, Chilis, Salads, Burgers, Dips
kidney_beans_details.varieties: Red kidney beans, Light red kidney beans, Dark red kidney beans

prerequisites.soil: Well-drained, loamy soil with a pH between 6.0 and 7.5
prerequisites.climate: Warm temperatures with a growing season of at least 60 to 90 days, and frost-free conditions.
prerequisites.water: Regular watering, especially during flowering and pod development, but avoid waterlogging.
prerequisites.frost: Kidney beans are sensitive to frost, so they should be planted after the last frost date.
prerequisites.space: Plant seeds or seedlings about 2 inches deep and 4 to 6 inches apart in rows spaced 18 to 36 inches apart.
